Cross-kingdom AI × Bias-aware evidence engine

Predicting Cross-Kingdom Therapeutics,Before They Reach the Lab.

NeuroBotanica is a cross-kingdom botanical intelligence platform that predicts novel dimeric cannabinoids and polysaccharide adjuvant synergies before physical synthesis, organizes evidence into tiers, and helps teams move from ideas to IND-ready formulations with clearer traditional knowledge attribution.

Cross-kingdom synergy engine

Unifies cannabis, marine, fungal, and plant polysaccharide data with traditional knowledge to propose safer combinations.

  • Structured literature and archive review
  • Cross-kingdom formulation hypotheses before physical synthesis
  • Exportable evidence summaries organized by evidence tier

Dimer & adjuvant intelligence

Focuses on dimeric cannabinoid structures, polysaccharide adjuvants, and their combined therapeutic hypotheses.

  • Dimer and adjuvant candidate triage
  • Formation probability and bias-aware modeling for diverse populations
  • Signals to prioritize for wet lab and clinical work

Validation Journey

From manuscript to deployment in four luminous steps.

Scrollytelling timeline pairs copper root systems with living data; ideal for Cloudflare Pages cinematic reveals.

01

Collect

Ingest manuscripts, lab assays, and dispensary data with clear provenance and demographic context.

Inputs mapped across botanical kingdoms

02

Model

Generate dimer and adjuvant hypotheses using bias-aware evidence modeling.

Shortlist of candidate structures and combinations

03

Prioritize

Rank candidates by therapeutic promise, safety profile, and community priorities.

Focus areas for wet lab and clinical work

04

Prepare

Organize evidence and metadata into documentation that supports regulatory and IRB review.

Faster handoffs into supplement and FDA-style pathways

Budtender Suite

Tablet-first cannabis intelligence for Nevada dispensaries.

The Budtender Suite is a dedicated, shared-device interface for floor staff. It surfaces strain guidance, terpene explanations, and patient-friendly talking points without exposing backend controls or PHI.

In Phase 1, this section anchors pilots and training; the live tablet UI is canonically served from the budtender.neuro-botanica.com subdomain.

Floor-ready workflows

Rapid strain lookup, terpene-centric guidance, and simple patient-facing narratives tailored to Nevada's regulatory context.

Open Budtender Suite (tablet)

Note: This link reflects the Phase 1 domain plan; DNS and deployment can be staged separately.
